actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1834.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 780. H.R. 1834 — "To advance policy priorities that will break the gridlock."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224
actions-list.actionItem: 202 (Roll no. 10).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 780 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1834) to advance policy priorities that will break the gridlock."
The Chair directed the Clerk to notify the Senate of the action of the House.
On motion to refer the bill and the accompanying veto message to the Committee on Natural Resources. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to refer the bill and accompanying veto message to the Committee on Natural Resources.

actions-list.header: On passage, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 248
actions-list.actionItem: 177, 1 Present (Roll no. 9).
The Chair announced the unfinished business to be the consideration of the veto.
The Chair directed the Clerk to notify the Senate of the action of the House.
On motion to refer the bill and the accompanying veto message to the Committee on Natural Resources. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to refer the bill and accompanying veto message to the Committee on Natural Resources.

actions-list.header: On passage, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 236
actions-list.actionItem: 188 (Roll no. 8).
The Chair announced the unfinished business to be the consideration of the veto.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 397
actions-list.actionItem: 28 (Roll no. 7).

actions-list.header: On Retaining Divisions B and C Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 419
actions-list.actionItem: 6 (Roll no. 6).

actions-list.header: On Retaining Division A Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 5). Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 375
actions-list.actionItem: 47 (Roll no. 5).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6938 — "Making consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on the veto message of the President to H.R. 504, the Chair put the question on will the House, on reconsideration, pass the bill, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding. Under the Constitution, the vote must be taken by the yeas and nays. Further proceedings were postponed until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

Pursuant to a previous order of the House of January 2, 2026, the unfinished business is the further consideration of the veto message of the President on H.R. 504. The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding.
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.

At the conclusion of debate on the veto message of the President to H.R. 131, the Chair put the question on will the House, on reconsideration, pass the bill, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding. Under the Constitution, the vote must be taken by the yeas and nays. Further proceedings were postponed until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

Pursuant to a previous order of the House of January 2, 2026, the unfinished business is the further consideration of the veto message of the President on H.R. 131. The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding.
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.
The Chair put the question on retaining Division A of H.R. 6938 and pursuant to H. Res. 977 the yeas and nays were ordered. The Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to section 4(a) of H. Res. 977, the Chair will put the question on retaining Division A of the bill, and then retaining Divisions B and C.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 6938.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4593, H.R. 5184 and H.R. 6938. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4593, H.R. 5184, and H.R. 6938 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and provides for one motion to recommit on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 977. H.R. 6938 — "Making consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
Mr. Cole asked unanimous consent that the question of retaining a portion of the bill on H.R. 6938 may be subject to postponement, as though under clause 8 of rule 20. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Tony Wied to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
